items.title: Car shoppers — following one rule can help keep costs down, CFP says

items.title: Want to Buy an RV? Follow These Steps
items.excerpt: Owning an RV can open a world of possibilities - the road stretching endlessly into the horizon, waking up to the sunrise over a picturesque lake. Yet there's a major roadblock to enjoying an RV. That, of course, is the need to buy one.

items.title: How Working in Retirement May Affect Your Social Security and Medicare
items.excerpt: Not all people who retire do so completely. While estimates vary, the data suggests that about one in five retirees continues to work in some way, per T. Rowe Price’s 2022 Retirement Saving & Spending Study.

items.title: How I Save Thousands of Dollars a Year By Riding a Scooter
items.excerpt: Two years ago I traded my 2015 Ford Focus for a scooter. The result? I now save about $4,000 a year — without feeling like I've sacrificed much.

items.title: Treasury, IRS finalize rule for 401(k) catch-up contributions. What it means for higher earners
items.excerpt: The IRS and U.S. Department of the Treasury this week finalized rules for certain provisions from the Secure 2.0 Act of 2022, including catch-up contributions for 401(k) and other plans, which apply to workers age 50 and older.

items.title: Third-quarter estimated tax deadline is Sept. 15. Why payments could be more complicated
items.excerpt: The third-quarter estimated tax deadline is Sept. 15 — and payments could be more complicated for some filers amid President Donald Trump 's tax changes for 2025 , experts say.

items.title: Retirement feels impossible for 1 in 5 Americans, survey finds. Experts say a plan can help
items.excerpt: Steve Baleno has been in the workforce for more than 30 years. He started saving for retirement with his first job, and boosted his savings each year as his salary increased.
